website_summaries.verdict: A very affordable, light-duty can opener from a trusted brand.
pros: Magnetic lid holder keeps messes at bay
cons: Cutting blade is plastic instead of metal, which raises some concerns about strength and durability

customer_reviews.title: Not the most durable looking, but incredibly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Not the most durable looking, but incredibly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker

customer_reviews.title: I love this can opener
customer_reviews.text: I love this can opener! I have terrible arthritis and have tried many other openers. This one is amazingly easy to operate. Once you place the can just lower the lever and the can opens by itself. The price is very reasonable. I would suggest to the company to advertise for people with arthritis because it sure makes my life a whole lot easier! Light weight and easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cape Cod Gramma

customer_reviews.title: FIND A DIFFERENT CAN OPENER
customer_reviews.text: This worked a very few times and then quit. The included 3-year warranty requires me to securely ship it to AZ and include another $10 for them to ship it back when repaired -- a total more than the $20 price of the new product. Definitely a strike against Cuisinart in my estimation.
customer_reviews.author: Traditionalist

customer_reviews.title: once Cuisinart, now morphed into something, but what "
customer_reviews.text: This appliance is not constructed with the high quality that has been the Hallmark of Cuisinart appliances for many years. This current product is manufactured off shore,(China) and lacks the durability and acceptable level of quality
customer_reviews.author: gejome

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Lever????
customer_reviews.text: I am normally a fan of Cuisinart products. (I own a Cuisinart mixer, toaster oven, griddle, food processor, etc.) So it disappoints me to have to give this product a poor review. On the very first use of the can opener, the plastic lever broke apart. I do hope Cuisinart will reconsider using plastic for this very important piece of the can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Deluxe Electric Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: I choose this can opener due to the brand name Cuisinart. It has simple styling and cleans easily. I like the fact that I can open large cans or tall cans. Many openers out there are too short for this and only open small cans. This has worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: cak

customer_reviews.title: A can opener should open cans, this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it based on the Cuisinart name. Mistake. The first can I tried to open just sat there and ground the label off. I had to force the can to turn, and was left with metal shavings on the bottom of the opener. Second can, same failure, metal shavings. Third can worked fine. What's going on? I think I'm returning it. It's not rocket science, There's only one way to put the can on, and the gear turns, but it doesn't grip the can. Maybe they got a bad bunch of gears, I got the lemon. My last electric can opener lasted 20 years, this one one isn't going to last a month.
customer_reviews.author: Allen S

customer_reviews.title: We were VERY disappointed yesterday when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews before purchasing this opener. I got this in the mail yesterday. We just spent a ton of money remodeling our kitchen, so with that we wanted some new small appliances. I too picked this because of the name and also the description says "Deluxe Can Opener, Stainless Steel". We were VERY disappointed yesterday when it arrived, because it is NOT stainless steel, but PLASTIC!!! Why can't they change the description to "Stainless steel color" or be a little more honest about the product? Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Harp

customer_reviews.title: Beware of metal that falls into open can!
customer_reviews.text: While the blade is cutting, it creates a skinny, spiral thread of metal that often falls into the opened can. It’s dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: KittyKatz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I had to get an electric can opener because of arthritis in my hands. I picked this one on looks and price. It turned out to be a good choice. The can opener works great. It has opened every can I have tried. It is tall enough for large cans, easy to use, easy to clean and is very quiet. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: michael lowery

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly Parents
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my mother who was struggling with a manual one at age 87. She didn't want but I convinced her to give it a try and she loves it. Uses cans a lot so very handy. Nice that it was white which went with her decor. Call it a win!
customer_reviews.author: Erik AM

customer_reviews.title: it would be great. It is not
customer_reviews.text: I thought by paying more and the name Cuisinart, it would be great. It is not. Since Ive received it, I have not been able to open a can all the way around by holding down the handle. It keeps stopping and I have to restart. A pain in the you know what.
customer_reviews.author: carole howell

customer_reviews.title: Warranty does not cover shipping to and from factory for warranty work.
customer_reviews.text: Just received it so can't evaluate it except to point out the flaw in it's 3 year warranty. You must pay to ship it back to Cuisinart for repair and include another $10 for return postage. The 3 year warranty was a major factor in purchasing this can opener but it is pretty much nullified by the cost of shipping to and from for warranty work. Sucks!
customer_reviews.author: R. Tribble

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the WORST Can Opener I've Ever Owned!!
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk worked fine for two weeks, but now it's useless! Well, not entirely useless. I am still able to open a can after six or seven tries, but come on! It's junk!! Save yourself some grief and buy something else, or just keep your manual can opener, because this thing is JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Had this can opener for two years now and I love it! Dependable & a dream to use! Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this can opener two years ago and it is still performing well! This is so dependable and easy to use! Before I purchased this one I had to keep replacing can openers every few months! It is a constant battle to open a can until I purchased this one! This one is so easy to use that even my elderly Mother can use it! I am disabled and have Cervical Stenosis in my hand and this can opener is so easy to use! I very highly recommend this can opener as it is the best one I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Picarelli

customer_reviews.title: Great basic can opener
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted. Nothing fancy and simple to use. The price was good compared to other brands. It is easy to use and tall enough for larger cans. Doesn't take up much space on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: CatrineTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different cans and they all were easily held and cut. Although, there were times were even after the lid was fully cut, it would still try to continue to cut instead of stopping haha. Ah well, also the things that keep it held up sometimes really have a strong hold so if you're doing some sort of soup it may jerk hard when pulling it off and may spill a little so be careful when pulling the can off and all that. But yeah, as its main operation is cutting the lid of cans off, it does that 100% perfectly and holds all sorts of weights of cans so it's all good!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: DOA and horrible return policy!
customer_reviews.text: The "refurbished" unit is junk! It either trips my GFI plug or it runs endlessly spins its wheels without actually opening the can. It has never successfully opened a single can for me. Beach Cameras return policy is such that I have to pay shipping, in prisintine packaging to send it back to them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Utter Piece Of Junk - Run!
customer_reviews.text: Utter piece of junk. First thing I did was throw the box away because I figured "it's a can opener, it'll be fine." Huge mistake, because now I can't return it. After reading the instructions and trying about 70 times the unit wouldn't grip a simple small can of chick peas. The guides are off, the blade can't get in the right place and the magnet is so weak the can falls immediately. How can they screw up something as simple as a can opener? Amazed Cuisinart would put out such a shoddy product.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: I hate this opener!
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked fine. However, I have probably used it a total of 8 times. After the first couple of uses, it started to give me problems. Today I am totally disgusted. I am trying to open a simple can and it will not puncture the can. I have tried everything. What a piece of junk! How difficult is it to build something that works these days? I'd be better off buying one at a thrift store that was made in a time when everything wasn't junk.
customer_reviews.author: Katlover

customer_reviews.title: Good, reasonably priced can opener
customer_reviews.text: After our last electric can opener died, we switched to hand held openers to clear off a little space on our cluttered countertop. We tried a variety of manual can openers and had troubles with most of them (rust, hard to turn, etc.). We found ourselves really missing our electric can opener. I looked on Amazon and found this Cuisinart electric can opener and decided to give it a try. We like it. It opens cans easily, is reasonably priced, its magnet “catches” the lid, and the blade portion pops out easily for cleaning. It is a good, reasonably priced opener. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Connie P

customer_reviews.title: A TALL CAN OPENER TO USE EXTRA TALL CANS UNDER IT TO OPEN
customer_reviews.text: I love this Cuisinart electric can opener. I wore out one and now I am on my second Cuisinart. The first one was just like this can opener. Very easy to use and is tall to get extra tall cans under it to open.
customer_reviews.author: sjctenn

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is great with one exception. Getting blade into correct spot is apparently difficult for kids and men. You just have to take a sec and make sure it lined up just right. I’ve had others that you just hold the can there and pop it right in with no attention. Other than that this product opens cans!
customer_reviews.author: L. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: I am shocked this is sold by Cuisinart, and even more shocked that from a QA stand point its shipped to customers...
customer_reviews.text: Simply doesn't work. The gear that is supposed grab a a can and spin the can, simply doesn't grasp the can. As a result, the gear spins, the can doesn't and to open a can you need to manually rotate the can. Its a horrible design. I am shocked this is sold by Cuisinart, and even more shocked that from a quality assurance stand point something like this is put into production and worse, shipped to customers. Repeat..DOES NOT WORK. I see now I am outside my return window which stinks for me. I will try anyway to return and get my money back..
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive and works well!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these in different locations. I am a cat rescue so I open about 20 cans of cat food a day. This can opener operates easily and holds up better than the other ones I have tried. Also has an attractive design. It will break if you try to open damaged cans with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rescue The Cats

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this can opener for a couple of months, and I've probably successfully opened 2 out of 8 cans that I've tried, since purchasing it. The blade doesn't seem to engage into the lid very well, and you have to help turn the can as it is trying to cut the lid, otherwise, the can will slip out of position and drop down on your counter top. My old Black and Decker can opener that I purchase for about $12 many years ago, never failed. I just wanted a new stainless look. I wish I has kept my old one!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, small issue
customer_reviews.text: The can opener arrived quickly, and it works quite well thus far. My reason for not giving it 5 stars is, it has a habit of grasping the labels on quite a few of the cans, tearing them and then jamming with the paper from them. Basically, as soon as the label catches, you need to stop the can opener, rip the label off, then return, the can to the opener to finish removing the lid. It's still a good value, if you start off by removing part of the label near the top of the can.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Nahid~

customer_reviews.title: Good can opener.!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. So overall it is a good quality product. I felt it it is little too tall to fit in my cabinet. I went to different stores to see if there are shorter ones . But it seems nowadays you can only get 10 inch and above in sizes. Do I decided to keep it. So far so good. It is working well. I like the auto shut down feature a lot. And does not leave any residuals of metal on the edges after cutting.!
customer_reviews.author: Veenzi

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: SECOND review - I hate it. It got stuck on a regular size can 4 times & I had to yank it off which spilled juice all over the counter because it wouldn't turn. It shredded the paper around the can & made another mess. It's horrible. I ended up using my hand-held opener. Worst can opener EVER. For a good name brand, I'm totally disappointed and now I'm stuck with it. I'll probably end up throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Where's the Stainless Steel Cuisinart?
customer_reviews.text: I'm disapointed with the can opener as there is very little stainless steel on it! Instead it's a cheap plastic sides that may look like stainless from a distance but when you get close up its very noticeable.im surprised Cuisinart would put out a sub par can opener with their brand name front center. Even when you pick it up it feels cheap,what a bummer
customer_reviews.author: Nor'easter

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad.
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure about the durability. Within a month the lever broke and had to replaced under warranty. Other than this it would have been nice if the cord were 6 inches longer. This one is too short at 18".
customer_reviews.author: R. H.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Handle keeps coming off
customer_reviews.text: This works good sometimes, but the handle that is supposed to cut into the can keeps coming off. You basically have to hold it on to the unit AND press it down onto the can, to get it to cut into the can. I don't understand why they can't have the handle secured to the stand. It didn't even last 6 months and it is broken, handle won't stay on; there's a little plastic piece that seems to be only partially there. This is junk with a nice appearance. I will not get this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mama

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: My rating is probably unfair in that most other can openers I've seen in the store have the same drawbacks. At first I thought it was a design flaw. The unit is so lightweight that it moves around while attaching the can. So are others, so this one can't be blamed. The cutting mechanism is a pain to align and unless done just right nothing happens because the connection isn't made. The mechanism is made to come out easily for cleaning which is a good thing, but unfortunately it comes out waaay too easily and must be reinserted even before opening a can. I actually returned the can opener.
customer_reviews.author: SpittinKitten

customer_reviews.title: Built to last!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had an electric can opener in years, but my arthritis became too severe to use a hand held can opener. I studied the ones Amazon offers and decided this was the one for me. I am so glad I purchased! Easy to use, clean cutting (no metal shavings inside the cans), easy to clean (usually doesn't require cleaning). Love this can opener, and highly recommend to anyone with arthritis looking to buy! Sure makes my time in the kitchen a lot easier. I don't believe you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: carlssister

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. The first one last about 6 years before the part you push down finally broke. I have had very few problems with it shredding the paper on cans but usually it runs very smoothly. It's good quality and does what it's suppose to. I prefer an electric can opener over a handheld because of problems with my hands. I'd recommend this can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Handy once you understand how it works
customer_reviews.text: I love using this as it comes in handy and it's pretty cool to use. It took me a bit to understand how it works but once I did I haven't stopped using it. My fear of the can falling off and making a mess took a while to get over but as I mentioned before once you understand how it works then you'll be comfy using it. Very easy to clean and small enough to pack away right away after using.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy

customer_reviews.title: it shreds the aluminum can
customer_reviews.text: Tip: Take the wrapper off the can you want to open, the gear likes to shred the packaging and aluminum can.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Ours broke 2 weeks after the return window closed
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product for anyone. We opened about a dozen cans with it overall. Then yesterday, it would not open a can and the handle fell off. Therefore at $16.49 and we opened 16-17 cans approximately, we figure it cost us $1 per can to open them. I remember in the old days, you bought a can opener like this and it is still working today. Maybe I can find a better one in a yard sale. Who ever heard of a can opener letting go?
customer_reviews.author: TJH Fiddler

customer_reviews.title: Worst can opener ever
customer_reviews.text: It takes 3-5 tries to get the cutter to engage. Then when it runs, you have to hold the can the entire time. If you don't, the opener may or may not just drop the can. The way the base sticks out, it guarantees that when the can lands, it throws the contents across the countertop. And, I mean, ALL the contents. They just get slinged. Horrible can opener from what should be a good brand. Save your money and buy ANYTHING else.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: Received a used product
customer_reviews.text: I am leaving 1 star. Would leave none if I could. Although the product works, it is OBVIOUS that is was previously used. There was FOOD on the blade. There were scrapes all along the bottom from cans. The magnet was worn and had dried FOOD on it! This was a CHRISTMAS gift!!!! Horrible! Disgusting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just simply works
customer_reviews.text: We love our electric can opener. Doesn't take up too much space, and looks very natural with other products on our counter being black & streamlined. We regularly open 28 oz. tomato cans with ease — the magnetic-arm has handled the weight perfectly fine! I don't expect wear-and-tear to be a major issue based on design simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It is a relief for my hands
customer_reviews.text: And it is old school, which is what I wanted. I also like that you can take off the cutter part and wipe it clean if needed. I already had one of the new type of can openers which opens cans from the outer edge. It is a cleaner cut, but you can't drain your tuna, veggies, etc using the lid. Also it was manual and turning the handle was becoming hard to do. I love this can opener and I recommend it to others who prefer the older technology.
customer_reviews.author: Girl #236

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was a good buy but it's JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: Can opener broke after using it for the SECOND time!!! I used it when we recieved it. Worked great. Put it away in a cabinet. Took it out to use it again and it went 1/3 around the can and stopped. Now it's dead!!! Just past return window. Super upset!!! Original review: Arrived quickly. Great price. Packed well. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism that is removable is flimsy and removes itself sometimes. I don't think this is up to the Cuisinart quality standard. They took shortcuts. I probably won't recommend nor would I buy another one. We'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Died After Less Than 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: What a bummer. Bought this because I have sore wrists and open a lot of dog food cans. It worked great while it lasted, but unfortunately that wasn't long. Less than 2 months after I bought it, I needed to open 3 cans in a row - it opened the first 2 just fine and then would not run. I tried different outlets, giving it a rest, etc. all to no avail. I wasn't expecting a $15 opener to last a lifetime, but 2 months is super weak. Unfortunately the return window passed at the 1 month mark so I just have to toss it. Really displeased with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Llama

customer_reviews.title: Not a great can opener
customer_reviews.text: It's a Cuisinart, I figured I'd love it. Nope. I was opening a 15 oz can and it stopped several times during the cut. I'd have to readjust. The magnet whose job is to stick to the lid seems to have issues with holding, too. It works as well as my other that I threw away that was without a magnet and whose cutting did a job similar to this.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Care Bear

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought Jan/26/2020 We tried opening several different cans, and each time, this did not cut all the way through the can. I wasted money on this piece of junk Save your money guys don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Somo

customer_reviews.title: Buy this can opener & you will stop wasting money!
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of buying the same junky hand-held can openers that break within months...This is the can opener to buy! My husband & I went through 3 hand-held can openers in a year, each time paying more money thinking that cost meant quality. We've had this Cuisinart can opener for over a year & it's the best!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Rose Allen

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart CCO-50BKN Deluxe Electric Can opener
customer_reviews.text: My Cuisinart CCO-50BKN Deluxe Electric Can opener is taller than I expected, but doesn't have a large footprint, so that is a minor problem for me. I haven't tried to open a can that large yet, but it has worked well on the cans I have opened with it. It seems sturdy and well-built and operates smoothly. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: A can opener that doesn't open cans!
customer_reviews.text: I got my can opener just 8 days ago. It is going into the garbage today. I've tried time and time again to open different cans of soup, vegetables, etc, and it doesn't work most of the time. I kept thinking that I must be doing something wrong - but how hard can it be? Today for the last time I tried to open a can - after 5 minutes of trying I gave up and got out the manual one that opened it right away! What a waste of time and money. Electric can openers worked well even decades ago, so how can one be made now that doesn't open a can???!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W.

customer_reviews.title: Great opener
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews...so many negative, I decided to take a RISK and ordered this opener. It is amazing...only $20....easy to use...push the lever, let go and the magnetic thing holds the lid until you release it. I don't understand all the negative comments...It's small, but tall enough not to tip over....takes little space on my counter....yes, sometimes label shavings are visible...so what? so remove them. Don't hesitate to buy this item...I love it. It does a great job!!
customer_reviews.author: gracious

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and great price!
customer_reviews.text: I read the previous reviews of this can opener and I’m SO glad I decided to give it a try. I LOVE this little can opener. The issue that others seem to have had with it tearing up the labels on cans has yet to be an issue for me. It loads easily, stops when finished and holds larger cans without issue at all. I’m super happy with my purchase and would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a reliable and inexpensive can opener. Totally worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Amy D.

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Easy to Clean/Remove only 3 stars because I haven't Needed to clean or remove parts. I can't rate them honestly 5 star until I've Actually had to clean or remove anything. 3 of 5 is kind of a Neutral rating. Neither Good nor Bad or Simple/Difficult. Only Dangerous thing about it is it's kind of TOO AMAZING. The can's edges are Razor sharp. Kind of similar to a paper cut times 100. Don't pay attention, you Bleed. Otherwise it's a Perfect combination of value and mechanical performance. Simplicity personified. Anyone who needs an electric can opener wouldn't be steered incorrectly SO LONG AS every can open from Cuisinart is the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Reaper

customer_reviews.title: Will not deal with cuisinart products again!
customer_reviews.text: Read directions on this product and used as described the opener could not open 4 different cans. I thought cuisinart was a good product, however, this particular item is useless. My neighbor brought a manual opener which worked fine on very can the cuisinart failed to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: thomas nugent

customer_reviews.title: Just like the "olden days"!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I'm reviewing a can opener. But, ALAS! They are no longer made the way they once were. This can opener is heavy. It is easy to clean as the metal part comes off for easy cleaning. It can manage a larger can but I must put my other hand below to support it. That's the only drawback and not a big one at that. Our last can opener lasted 3-years of daily use. I suspect this one will last longer as it's just better quality.
customer_reviews.author: PiTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Awful, awful, awful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I thought it would live up to it;s reputable name. Pretty to look at, but DO NOT buy this product. It stopped working after three uses. Unfortunately, the return date had already lapsed, so I was stuck! Waste of money! If I could give it a 0 rating, I would! Buyers, beware!
customer_reviews.author: Elsie M. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and well made. Works every time.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not very different from the one I replaced which lasted nearly 15 years. Everything works as expected. One user showed a picture of a broken handle. I do not understand how in the world this could happen. One must have "misused" it to break the handle. Once the can is properly engaged, the blade punctures the can easily when the handle comes down. There is very little force necessary in the operation. I suppose it is possible to break the handle when the can is not properly lined up and the blade hits the solid metal edge rather than the thin metal.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dai

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheaply made and always comes apart
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I expected from a Cuisinart product. It is very challenging to get a can to properly fit under the blade and you have to always re-adjust the can until the product actually starts to work. Rarely does it do it the first time or the second. Also, while it is easy to remove the cutting mechanism for cleaning it also makes it come out constantly when you don't want it to. While it does cut well, by the time you get it to cut the can you will be frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: W. Reagan

customer_reviews.title: gotta say , i wish i have bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: i have big dogs so i buy big cans of food for them , hand openers not only didnt last long you had to make 3 pass's to get the top cut , this thing motors through those cans like its nobody's business ,its also extremely easy to use and looks very nice so i just keep it between the coffee maker and the toaster , it cuts the lids first time every time , i only write reviews when im very pleased or very disappointed , this product im extremely pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds heavy cans
customer_reviews.text: I don't have the strength in my hands to use a manual can opener any more. This electric can opener is compact and holds heavy cans. There is a magnet that catches the lid. As others mentioned, the can's paper label gets shredded. I sometimes have a problem positioning the can so the cutter works, but I get better with experience.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mix

customer_reviews.title: This is the first electronic can opener I’ve ever loved
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of electric can openers that have been everything from just usable to being pretty good. This one is excellent! Put a can where it is supposed to go, lower the lever, can is open. This does what a can opener is supposed to do with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This can opener works well, and I only have a minor issue with it. When raising the handle to remove the can, I often disengage the entire handle mechanism from the base. The handle and gears are removable for cleaning, but I find them coming off much more often than intended. Other than that it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: I had had an electric can opener that for some time had often refused to hold or open a can. It was annoying--but now that Campbell soup has reverted to using sealed tops and not pop tops--I knew i had to get a can opener that would work--and not require time and clever technique. This is THE ONE. It holds the can properly and then retains it. It works on small and tall cans. This is thus far a marvelous buy!!
customer_reviews.author: D.Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart SCO-60 durability Review
customer_reviews.text: The first Cuisinart SCO-60 Deluxe Stainless Steel Can Opener lasted 3 years with 9 cans a week use. It is sturdy with a medium footprint weighted bottom, tall, easy to clean surface and removable handle/blade. The weakest part is the can drive gear is connected to the motor via a plastic splined push-on connector. With age, heavy cans or cans that get jammed will brake the plastic connector between the drive gear and the motor and the can will no longer turn under the blad. It opens all can sizes quickly without leaving sharp jagged edges. The best feature is the hands-free AUTO stop.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel frank

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful electric can opener
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of strength in wrists and have difficulty opening cans - this can opener is the easier one I've used and I highly recommend it. No parts to assemble and it opens cans very quickly, holding the can until you're ready to take it off the opener.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Artjritic hands
customer_reviews.text: At the age of 64 3/4, my hands can't operate the handheld can opener without some pretty severe pain from arthritis. Years ago, it seemed like the kitchen wasn't 'normal' without an electric can opener. They say that everything comes back in style, but in this case, the need and the fix were a necessity. Works with ease and the stainless finish is attractive!
customer_reviews.author: Illinois Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke after less than 10 uses. The top shining ...
customer_reviews.text: broke after less than 10 uses. The top shining chrome piece that holds the can broke to half. It is made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: C. Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Works great sharp and magnet hold tight
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use blades are sharp which you would think is common when buying a new one but nope this was bought because another one I purchased just wasn't sharp and had hard time using this is easy to use magnet holds large cans easily as well
customer_reviews.author: Keith and Nada

customer_reviews.title: Got tired of breaking manual can openers
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through three can openers in the past year. I have tried different sturdy brands, but they always crap out on me between my dog's food and the amount of Garbanzos I eat. This opener makes life more efficient. I always had an electric can opener growing up.. don't know why it took me so long to get one as an adult. It is a fairly light weight, which concerns me. And I am not sure how the blade will hold up to rust. But, it cuts like a dream. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Opens large cans hands free with ease.  This is the one  you want.
customer_reviews.text: The stablilizing plast ledge on the lower front end of this can opener is genius. This is the third electric can opener I have purchased from Amazon, determined to find one that could open large cans without me holding down the lever and without any jamming issues. This is the one that works. Its a keeper; and half the price of the two other can openers. I hope you find this helpful. I'm too busy to be standing around holding my hand on the lever or fussing with the can. It needs to be full automatic and simply open the can gracefully. This is the one.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Nunya

customer_reviews.title: great quality can opener
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my senior mom after she broke both of her wrists and had trouble opening cans even in recovery for several months. Her old cheaper can opener was a pain to use but this one was much smoother and easier for her. She has no idea it was a little on the pricey side but I am just so glad she likes it so well. I'd buy the same one for myself if I needed one. It looks very nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M

customer_reviews.title: Poor job for an expensive product
customer_reviews.text: I thought paying $40 Cuisenart can opener would be wonderful...but it's not, it does a poor job opening regular cans, and won't open big cans at all, waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Janet Hawkes

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: After trying one of these battery robot openers - and sent it back - this is a breath of fresh air. Very easy to use and I haven't had the first glitch. It takes up very little counter space and the cord allows moving to the front of the counter if needed. Nearly one-hand operation, and very easy to run, lifts the lid, fairly quiet, and I haven't had it tear labels so far. I'll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: RuCYnic

customer_reviews.title: A new way to open a can!
customer_reviews.text: I threw out my old electric can opener when this new Can Opener arrived on time and well packaged. I plugged it in and it worked easily and exceeded my expectations. I love how it holds the can in place until I can carefully remove it and the now cut out lid. Magically it cuts the lid underneath the seam at the top of the can, which makes the new empty can harmless to cutting your fingers, like my old can opener did. Therefore, I want to thank whoever invented this small kitchen appliance, since I greatly appreciate your product.
customer_reviews.author: Incognitus Architectus

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The can opener arrived with rust on the opener area and the base. I plugged it up and it didn’t work. The way it was packaged it looked like a previous return. I bought Cuisinart because I wanted the best. Very disappointed and am returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: The high ratings for a *different* Cuisinart can opener (stainless steel can opener) are being mixed up with this cheap, worthless, lightweight piece of plastic garbage. DO NOT BUY this product. Buy the one with "stainless steel" in the description
customer_reviews.author: AggieEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Great automatic can opener!
customer_reviews.text: I love this can opener! Can’t believe I’ve been doing it manually for all these years. This one, you just plug in the cord, put the can in its place and press down on the lever. It automatically stops and there is a magnet that catches the lid so you don’t have to fish for it and risk cutting a finger. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Love Luu

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS VERY WELL!
customer_reviews.text: I simply can't imagine not having an electric can opener. This one is a bit pricey but worth it. It's quiet, has a very even smooth cutting edge and does hold the can and lifts the lid with a magnet at the end of the process...even heavy cans. This opener is just about as perfect as it can get. I'm quite pleased and certainly highly recommend it. I was a bit hesistant due to the higher price, but it's worth it...and more! If you purchase, you won't be disappointed! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lady in Virginia Beach

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint, speedy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a "can man", but when meal time calls for it--- this opener delivers strongly. First off, it's small, so storage is very convenient. Second, it works. Now, I have only tried it on "normal" cans -- not giant cans of lard, syrup, etc.... It worked well on my large-ish sized tuna cans, and with few parts, separation and cleanup is easy. So-- if the can fits under the machine, it will be opened in a timely and tidy manner. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: TX_Iron

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh, Not So Much...
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I got this unit was that you could lock it and walk away while opening a can. It keeps dropping and spilling cans on my counter top. Regular size cans Bush Beans & Sweet Peas (16.5oz). It is also a bit tricky to puncture the can initially, it is an angle issue; which I hope I may get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: works well with small and average size cans
customer_reviews.text: This can opener has a solid base and is slender considering other can openers. The mechanism is easy to take off to clean. It opens small and average size cans with ease, no problems. But it has a hard time holding and moving along a larger size #10 can. The motor tends to work too hard, it won't stop. You have to wiggle the can and the handle and push the can around. Very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: bogc

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: If you want (or need) an electric can opener this is a solidly built, affordably priced unit. Yes the body is plastic, however since the body is just the stand for the working parts I don't see how that's going to wear under normal use. It grips a can well, the magnet pops the lid out of the can once it's been cut free, and the can stays in place until you lift the lever and release it. What more would one ask of a can opener?
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous product
customer_reviews.text: This opener is dangerous. Opening cans, please watch for fine metal shavings. This is not acceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great can opener!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this can opener. After buying the cheapest can openers and always having problems and replacing them in about a year, I'm so relieved to have one that works so well. It's easy to clean, and easier to store with it's sleek design.
customer_reviews.author: Landab

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart - what happened?
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart used to be a brand of quality products. This is so cheaply made, lightweight plastic and does not keep good contact to open. A heavy can almost tips it over. Why do cheap crap products from China have the Cuisinart name - misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Shipley

customer_reviews.title: I'm so loving this can opener.
customer_reviews.text: Last year i purchased a kenmore can opener from sears, I took it back as it was terrible opening cans. Then ireplaced it with an Oster from Amazon. Hated it from day one, in orde4r to open certain cans, had to remove paper. It was terrible, it finally broke and i replaced it with this Cuisinart. I've only opened 2 cans as it arrived yesterday, but It opened c ans on first try both times, flawlessly...... I highly recommend this can opener, and the price is reasonable...
customer_reviews.author: Carole S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome can opener!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one similar to this one, but instead of opening the can from the top it opened it below the rim on the side of the can. Making it impossible to use the lid to drain the contents of the can. I returned that one and purchased this one instead. I must say this one seems VERY reliable! And it is quiet compared to any other can opener I have owned!! I am VERY pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Out2Lunch

customer_reviews.title: It helps my mom
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! My mom is getting older and doesn’t have the strength to open cans with a manual opener anymore. That’s where this product comes in! It was super easy to set up and explain to my mom how to use it. She’s so happy with it and will bring it up in conversations if she’s used it! Definitely a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but slightly tricky to use
customer_reviews.text: This works fine, once I figured it out, and it was inexpensive, so I am happy. However, it is a bit of a tricky process to figure out how to get the can in the right position so part of me wonders if another can opener would have been easier to use. It is overall fine though.
customer_reviews.author: E Shipp

customer_reviews.title: Broke in Three Months
customer_reviews.text: One doesn't expect much from a $20 can opener but this item didn't meet those minimal expectations. Within three months of purchase, something broke inside and the gear with the teeth that turns the can no longer turns. You can clearly hear something rattling around inside. To add insult to injury, the three year limited warranty gives us the privilege of paying Cuisinart $10 to ship us a replacement. And then we get to pay to ship the broken one to them. USPS one cost shipper is $5.20. So that's $15 to replace a $20 can opener plus the hassle of messing with them. I would rather put the $15 into another can opener which might last over three months.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Tricky
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to get the can in the correct position for it to be penetrated. Especially large cans. Maybe because I'm left handed, but I've had other electric can openers and not had that issue. I'm not happy with it and will no doubt replace it soon.
customer_reviews.author: A. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Love this can opener. Tall enough for tall tomato juice cans. Magnet holds the lid after opening. It is easy to line up the blade to the lid for opening; very little effort. You don't need to hold the handle down while it is opening the can; push the handle down and it moves on its own. Very quiet; and haven't experienced any splash or goo on the opener or blade yet. Stainless steel shines like the day I bought it - no streaks.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Miller

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, lightweight but gets the job done for now
customer_reviews.text: This thing feels cheap, nothing like the photos. After a few months of use, I now know that I should have bought another can opener. It’s easy to use but made of cheap plastic (except can cutting mechanism). There’s no telling how long it’ll last.
customer_reviews.author: passat driver

customer_reviews.title: This can opener really saved me
customer_reviews.text: I am beginning to see the effects of arthritis in my hands and a manual can opener was becoming a chore as well as painful to use. This can opener has really made my life easier and less painful when preparing canned foods. I also love the fact that the entire cutting head can be removed for easy cleanup. Highly recommend this can opener for anyone who has lost strength in their hands or if opening cans with a manual opener has become painful.
customer_reviews.author: Martino

customer_reviews.title: An Absolute Piece of Crap!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 30-year-old Rival can opener/knife sharpener that had finally started to behave badly. I thought I was going "up market" by purchasing a Cuisinart -- I will NEVER purchase anything else bearing that name. Cheap plastic housing, a "spike" that drags around the can leaving VERY ragged edges, a wheel to turn the can which also makes confetti out of any labels leaving clean-up I never had to do before. Requiring me to give a star rating to this item only adds insult to injury. Note to Amazon: add a Big Red "X" to the star system so that no one will be misled by simply scanning the stars and not reading the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: J M Raedy

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for the elderly
customer_reviews.text: My mom came down with shingles this past summer and couldn't use her dominant hand and arm. I didn't realize she still had a manual can opener until she asked me to open a can of tuna. She was so happy when she opened this and still loves it even tho she's now shingle free. She's losing strength in her hands and struggles with everyday things including trying to operate a manual can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bird

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this can opener!
customer_reviews.text: BEST can opener I have EVER owned. I have tried MANY electric can openers over the years and have consistently been disappointed. (Always reluctantly go back to the manual hand operated one which is very hard to crank.) This can opener is the exception! I was delighted and surprised when on the FIRST attempt, with minimal effort, it easily opened my can! It is smooth and SO easy to use. Works like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Purchased because it said it would open large cans. It will not open a large can of green beans. Waste of money. If you’ll only be opening cans of soup you’re good... but anything larger than that will be a crap shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Altoprincess

customer_reviews.title: Great Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: This can opener is sleek and easy to use. There really is no need for directions. It handles cans of al sSizes and makes a very clean, smooth ut. Good size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: brea2942

customer_reviews.title: Easy to line cans up to cutting blade
customer_reviews.text: I like the Cuisinart brand as their products are made to a higher quality than most. This has a metal body, not plastic. I’m left-handed and using my old electric can opener was always a challenge for me to line up the can but not with this one. I also like that it handles the 28 oz cans as easily as smaller cans. I expect this can opener to last for a lot longer than the two years my last one did. I use a Cuisinart 4 slice toaster daily and it’s going on 5 years now. My previous toasters by other manufacturers barely lasted 2 years and some only lasted for a year.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CCO-50BKN Deluxe Electric Can Opener, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style Name:Can OpenerCuisinart CCO-50BKN Deluxe electric can opener, blackelectric can opener with precision power cut blade press-and-release lever for easily opening any standard-size can extra-wide base prevents sliding or tipping; stops automatically magnetic lid holder; removable activation lever; easy-to-clean design Measures 5-8/9 by 6 by 10-8/9 inches; 3-year limited warranty Features: Cuisinart quality-engineered motor system|Power Cut blade|Single-touch operation|Sturdy base prevents sliding or tipping|Opens any size can|Removable activation lever for easy cleaning|Limited 3-year warranty|BPA free

BRAND STORY
By Cuisinart
feature_bullets: Electric can opener with precision Power Cut blade. Cord length : 36 Inches

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars11,314 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
